meanings.definition: A position giving a strategic advantage, commanding perspective, or comprehensive view.
meanings.sent1: From his vantages on the hill, the general could see the entire battlefield clearly.
meanings.sent2: The rooftop terrace offered a vantage point to admire the city skyline.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat climbed the tree for a vantage to spy on the birds.
meanings.sent4: Standing on the balcony, she had a vantage akin to a bird perched high above.
meanings.sent5: The drone provided a vantage that made it seem like she had eyes in the sky.

meanings.definition: A benefit or advantage gained from a particular situation or course of action.
meanings.sent1: The discount was a vantage that made the purchase even more appealing.
meanings.sent2: His experience in marketing gave him a vantage in understanding consumer behavior.
meanings.sent3: Eating the last cookie gave him the vantage of satisfying his sweet tooth.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude was a vantage that brightened the mood of the entire team.
meanings.sent5: The early start to the project gave them a vantage in completing it ahead of schedule.
